cards.flavor: Millaray used her history magic to unconver a near-forgotten tale: the Caica-Relonche War.
cards.name: Abandoned Chamber
cards.originalText:
Abandoned Chamber enters the battlefield with X story counters on it. 
{3}, {T}, Remove all story counters from Abandoned Chamber and exile it: Return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each counter removed this way.
cards.text:
Abandoned Chamber enters the battlefield with X story counters on it. 
{3}, {T}, Remove all story counters from Abandoned Chamber and exile it: Return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each counter removed this way.

cards.flavor: “Even after I'm gone, I'll never avert my gaze from my people.”
cards.name: Amancay, Weichafe Exemplar
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever a Warrior you control dies, it deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever a Warrior you control dies, it deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Condor's Protection
cards.originalText:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Whenever a Warrior you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, that player loses 1 life and discards a card, then you draw a card and gain 1 life.
cards.text:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Whenever a Warrior you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, that player loses 1 life and discards a card, then you draw a card and gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: The ancestral spirits of clan founders, the pillan fight for the Relonche in the afterlife, but if one were to be made upset by a human's actions...
cards.name: Ancient Pillan
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Ancient Pillan enters the battlefield, it fights up to one target creature an opponent controls.
cards.text:
Trample
When Ancient Pillan enters the battlefield, it fights up to one target creature an opponent controls.

cards.flavor: ...there would only be one solution.
cards.name: Volcano Sacrifice
cards.originalText:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would be put into a graveyard or not resolve.)
Volcano Sacrifice deals damage to target creature or planeswalker equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.text:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would be put into a graveyard or not resolve.)
Volcano Sacrifice deals damage to target creature or planeswalker equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Antu, Sun Spirit
cards.originalText:
Antu, Sun Spirit can't attack or block unless you control ten or more permanents.
As long as it's your turn, other creatures you control get +X/+0 and have haste, where X is the amount of life you've gained this turn.
When Antu dies or is put into exile from the battlefield, you may put him into his owner's library third from the top.
cards.text:

cards.name: Aukan, Swift Hawk
cards.originalText:
Menace, haste
At the beginning of combat on your turn, gain control of up to two target noncreature, nonland permanents your opponents control until end of turn. Untap those permanents. You may attach any number of Equipment among them to creatures you control until end of turn. (They unattach at end of turn.)
cards.text:

cards.name: Bloodsucking Pihuchen
cards.originalText:
Flying, deathtouch
When Bloodsucking Pihuchen enters the battlefield, choose a nonland card name.
Whenever a permanent with the chosen name enters the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.text:
Flying, deathtouch
When Bloodsucking Pihuchen enters the battlefield, choose a nonland card name.

cards.name: Calfu, Greatest Toqui
cards.originalText:
Calfu, Greatest Toqui is all colors.
As long as there are five or more basic land types among lands you control, other creatures you control get +2/+1 and have vigilance.
When Calfu dies, you may search your library for a card named Heart of Caru Mapu, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

cards.flavor: Each plane under the Intisuyu was sent envoys to ensure all riches were equally distributed, and that the emperor got his share.
cards.name: Capac's Envoy
cards.originalText:
When Capac's Envoy enters the battlefield, draw a card. 
If one or more players would draw a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, instead each player may draw a card.
cards.text:
When Capac's Envoy enters the battlefield, draw a card. 
If one or more players would draw a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, instead each player may draw a card.

cards.flavor: Each Capac inherits the planeswalker spark of their predecessor, enabling them to see all that goes on in the many planes of the Intisuyu.
cards.name: Capac's Oversight
cards.originalText: Exile any number of target artifacts and/or enchantments you control, then return them to the battlefield under your control.
cards.text: Exile any number of target artifacts and/or enchantments you control, then return them to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: After Amancay's death, the Caica and the Relonche fought until there wasn't a single unwounded soldier in either army...
cards.name: Carnal Warfare
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, all creatures gain deathtouch and “When this creature dies, its controller loses 2 life.”
cards.text: Until end of turn, all creatures gain deathtouch and “When this creature dies, its controller loses 2 life.”

cards.flavor: ...but in Caru Mapu, new life can be born from even the bloodiest battlefield.
cards.name: Regrowth from Ruin
cards.originalText:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If you do, you gain 2 life.
cards.text:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If you do, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor:
“A single one of my Ch'aska Walla can do in a minute what a hundred men couldn't do in a year.”
—Shining Capac Upanqui
cards.name: Ch'aska Walla Captain
cards.originalText: When Ch'aska Walla Captain enters the battlefield, if you cast it, you may return an enchantment card from your graveyard to the battlefield. When you do, you gain life equal to that enchantment's mana value.
cards.text: When Ch'aska Walla Captain enters the battlefield, if you cast it, you may return an enchantment card from your graveyard to the battlefield. When you do, you gain life equal to that enchantment's mana value.

cards.flavor: “I'm afraid you're all that stands between me and the end of my relay. And I could really use some chicha right now.”
cards.name: Ch'aska Walla Chasqui
cards.originalText:
As long as you control three or more creatures with the same name, Scouts and Wizards you control can't be blocked.
A deck can have any number of cards named Ch'aska Walla Chasqui.
cards.text:
As long as you control three or more creatures with the same name, Scouts and Wizards you control can't be blocked.
A deck can have any number of cards named Ch'aska Walla Chasqui.

cards.flavor: “I don't mean to question the Capac, but I do wonder why he only called for rank and file troops in this new conquest of his. Perhaps he fears the collateral damage.”
cards.name: Ch'aska Walla Vanguard
cards.originalText:
Lifelink
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Ch'aska Walla Vanguard.
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Ch'aska Walla Vanguard.

cards.flavor: “Some of the Ch'aska Walla are so emboldened by their new toys that they forget tracing a road requires paying attention.”
cards.name: Chasqui Veteran
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Chasqui Veteran deals combat damage to a player, if you control three or more artifacts and/or enchantments, draw a card.
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Chasqui Veteran deals combat damage to a player, if you control three or more artifacts and/or enchantments, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“Sami found an abandoned Caica estate that Phyrexia didn't care for. Here I will find the way home.”
— Millaray Antillanca
cards.name: Climbing the Oldest Mountain
cards.originalText:
When Climbing the Oldest Mountain enters the battlefield, draw a card, then choose a card name.
Whenever a creature you control with the chosen name deals combat damage to a player, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.text:
When Climbing the Oldest Mountain enters the battlefield, draw a card, then choose a card name.
Whenever a creature you control with the chosen name deals combat damage to a player, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: If sightings of it weren't extremely rare, would there be so many great warriors named after it?
cards.name: Colocolo
cards.originalText:
Creatures you control named Colocolo can't be blocked and have ward {2}. 
{U}{U}: Put an inspiration counter on target creature. It's named Colocolo in addition to its other names for as long as it has an inspiration counter on it.
cards.text:
Creatures you control named Colocolo can't be blocked and have ward {2}. 
{U}{U}: Put an inspiration counter on target creature. It's named Colocolo in addition to its other names for as long as it has an inspiration counter on it.

cards.name: Condor Clearings
cards.originalText:
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, create a 1/1 white and black Bird creature token with flying and vigilance.
Whenever three or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a creature. If they can't, they discard a card.
cards.text:

cards.flavor: Dominarian tomes said Caru Mapu was destroyed by the Phyrexians, but the Caica archives Millaray found implied otherwise. Tired of hesitating, she planeswalked towards the truth.
cards.name: Conflicting Records
cards.originalText: An opponent separates all noncreature, nonland cards in your graveyard into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and exile the other. Exile Conflicting Records.
cards.text: An opponent separates all noncreature, nonland cards in your graveyard into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and exile the other. Exile Conflicting Records.

cards.flavor: Called rewe, they're installed in front of a machi's house as a place of purity and spirituality.
cards.name: Consecrated Altar
cards.originalText:
{T}: Mill three cards. Scry 1.
{1}, Sacrifice Consecrated Altar: Counter target spell or ability that targets you or one or more cards in your graveyard.
cards.text:
{T}: Mill three cards. Scry 1.
{1}, Sacrifice Consecrated Altar: Counter target spell or ability that targets you or one or more cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Capac Upanqui expanded the Caica empire to more planes than any other emperor before him.
cards.name: Cosmic Expansion
cards.originalText:
When Cosmic Expansion enters the battlefield, draw a card, then choose a card name.
Whenever one or more creatures you control with the chosen name deal combat damage to a player, you may create a token that's a copy of another target artifact or enchantment you control.
cards.text:
When Cosmic Expansion enters the battlefield, draw a card, then choose a card name.
Whenever one or more creatures you control with the chosen name deal combat damage to a player, you may create a token that's a copy of another target artifact or enchantment you control.

cards.flavor: Though the kalku eventually decided to aid their Relonche brethren against the incoming invasion, the decision was a close one.
cards.name: Council of the Warlocks
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, tap an untapped Warlock you control.
Search your library for a card and put it into your hand or graveyard, then shuffle.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, tap an untapped Warlock you control.
Search your library for a card and put it into your hand or graveyard, then shuffle.

cards.flavor: Between a machi and a kalku there's only one decision.
cards.name: Darkened Rites
cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability you control, you may destroy that creature. If you do, you lose 2 life.
If you would return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand, you may return it to the battlefield instead. If you do, you lose 2 life.

cards.flavor: Though angels were brought to Caru Mapu by outsiders, the Relonche are not ones to refuse the selfless aid they offer.
cards.name: Defender of Caru Mapu
cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever you attack, if you've cast a spell from a graveyard this turn, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, put Defender of Caru Mapu from your graveyard onto the battlefield. It's attacking.

cards.name: Dekinn, Depths Spirit
cards.originalText:
Dekinn, Depths Spirit can't attack or block unless a player has lost 3 or more life this turn.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may create a colorless Mountain land token. If they do, Dekinn deals 3 damage to them.
When Dekinn dies or is put into exile from the battlefield, you may put him into his owner's library third from the top.

cards.flavor: The spirits of the Relonche are attuned enough to each other...
cards.name: Devious Kalku
cards.originalText:
Menace
When Devious Kalku enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card, put that card into your graveyard, then shuffle.
cards.text:
Menace

cards.flavor: ...that a sudden chill could mean a loved one has just frozen to death.
cards.name: Last Goodbye
cards.originalText:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would be put into a graveyard or not resolve.)
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn. When that creature dies this turn, other creatures its controller controls get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “Oh young man, would you be able to part with some food? Me and my friends can repay your deed in kind...”
cards.name: Disheveled Vagabond
cards.originalText: Whenever you or a creature you control become the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, that opponent gets a spite counter.
cards.text: Whenever you or a creature you control become the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, that opponent gets a spite counter.

cards.originalText:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would be put into a graveyard or not resolve.)
Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each spite counter they have. If they didn't sacrifice any creatures this way, they discard that many cards instead.

cards.flavor: “Upanqui's expansionism may brings us more resources, but it also stretches them thin. We need to look after our own, too.”

cards.originalText:
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
Lands you control enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.text:
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: “Even if this delivery will go beyond the stars, it's still the same relay as always.”

cards.originalText:
When Empire's Glory enters the battlefield, draw a card, then choose a card name.
Whenever a creature with the chosen name enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control that shares a creature type with it. Those creatures gain haste until end of turn.
cards.text:

cards.flavor: When the Relonche started winning the war of attrition, Upanqui revealed his real army.
cards.name: Enter the Ch'aska Walla
cards.originalText: Create four 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens, then put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to four creatures you control. Draw a card for each creature you control with power 4 or greater. You gain 4 life.
cards.text: Create four 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens, then put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to four creatures you control. Draw a card for each creature you control with power 4 or greater. You gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: At the peak of the Intisuyu's power, even some of their guinea pigs could shape worlds.
cards.name: Envoy of Divine Progress
cards.originalText:
Protection from mana value 2 or less
Whenever Envoy of Divine Progress deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for an enchantment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Fletcher Kalku
cards.originalText:
When Fletcher Kalku enters the battlefield or attacks, you may exile a card from your hand face down. If you do, draw a card.
You may look at cards exiled with Fletcher Kalku.
{U}{U}, Reveal a card exiled with Fletcher Kalku: Counter target spell if it has the same mana value as the revealed card. Then put the exiled card into its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Tired of the dullness of his life, he gave it to the sea, becoming an envoy of the divine.
cards.name: Grandpa Hutao, Sea's Voice
cards.originalText:
You may play enchantment spells from your graveyard if you haven't cast a spell with that name this turn.
At the beginning of your end step, choose up to one enchantment you control. Shuffle the rest into your library.
cards.text:
You may play enchantment spells from your graveyard if you haven't cast a spell with that name this turn.

cards.flavor: The greatest leader among the Relonche died to illness after failing to listen to the commands of the divine. But before his death, he found the heart of the land, and claimed whoever could lift it would succeed him.
cards.name: Heart of Caru Mapu
cards.originalText:
Heart of Caru Mapu enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add X mana in any combination of colors, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
cards.text:
Heart of Caru Mapu enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add X mana in any combination of colors, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.flavor: The pucatrihueke, fallen warriors bound to sea and storm, protect Grandpa Hutao, the bearer of the sea's blessing.
cards.name: Hutao's Wardens
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Hutao's Wardens deals 2 damage to each opponent. Then if that spell was an enchantment, scry 2.
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Hutao's Wardens deals 2 damage to each opponent. Then if that spell was an enchantment, scry 2.

cards.name: Illari, Martyrized Tyrant
cards.originalText:
Vigilance
When Illari, Martyrized Tyrant enters the battlefield, tap all other nonbasic permanents.
Players can't untap more than one nonbasic permanent during each of their untap steps.
When Illari dies, untap all permanents you control and you gain 5 life.

cards.flavor:
“Through my blessings and their efforts, my children have reached new heights, and now divinity courses through the edge of their artifice.”
—Wira Inti, Skyfather
cards.name: Intisuyu's Masterpiece
cards.originalText:

cards.flavor: Envious of how his brother's territory was more appreciated than his own...
cards.name: Kaivilu, Ocean Warden
cards.originalText:
Flash
When Kaivilu, Ocean Warden enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 and lose all abilities until end of turn.
cards.text:
Flash

cards.flavor: ...he raised the seas skyward, driving humanity to the brink of extinction.
cards.name: The Great Flooding

Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would be put into a graveyard or not resolve.)
Return all creatures to their owners' hands. Each player discards two cards.

Enchant creature
When Kalku Initiation enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life and discard a card.

cards.name: Kuyen, Moon Spirit
cards.originalText:
Kuyen, Moon Spirit can't attack or block unless there are ten or more cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of each opponent's end step, create two Food tokens. Then you may pay 3 life. If you do, surveil 3, then draw two cards.
When Kuyen dies or is put into exile from the battlefield, you may put her into her owner's library third from the top.

cards.flavor:
“You insolent brat! You truly believe that you can defeat me? I'm giving you one last chance: Surrender in the name of your people, or watch them all die!”
—Shining Capac Upanqui, to Amancay
cards.name: Last Offer
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent attacks, exile Last Offer. If you do, target opponent sacrifices an attacking creature and you return another enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.text: Whenever an opponent attacks, exile Last Offer. If you do, target opponent sacrifices an attacking creature and you return another enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: “You can't just skip the ceremony, Amancay.With these invaders in our land, the spiritual health of our people is more important, not less.”
cards.name: Lihuen, Patient Machi
cards.originalText:
Hexproof from spells cast from a graveyard
If a creature you control would die and that creature was the target of an instant or sorcery spell this turn, you may put it on top of its owner's library instead.
cards.text:
Hexproof from spells cast from a graveyard

cards.flavor: Though new planes offered countless new possibilities of production and commerce, most Caica were just content to have the safety of their way of life assured.
cards.name: Llama Pasture
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {C}.
At the beginning of your end step, if you control three or more enchantments, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 0/1 white Llama creature token.
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
At the beginning of your end step, if you control three or more enchantments, you may pay {W}. If you do, create a 0/1 white Llama creature token.

cards.flavor: The machi are the Relonche's spiritual guides, in charge of healing both bodies and souls...
cards.name: Machi Initiate
cards.originalText: Whenever you gain life for the first time each turn, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land or creature card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.text: Whenever you gain life for the first time each turn, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land or creature card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: ...as well as ensuring the dead join their ancestors.
cards.name: Ceremony of Safe Passage
cards.originalText:
Legacy (You may play this side of this card only from your graveyard. Exile it if it would be put into a graveyard or not resolve.)
Shuffle any number of target cards in graveyards into their owners' libraries. 
Scry 2, then you gain 3 life.

Shuffle any number of target cards in graveyards into their owners' libraries.

cards.flavor: A machi's curative process can take hours. Her assisting crew, called llancañ, stay by her side to ensure she remains in focus.
cards.name: Machi's Assistants
cards.originalText: When Machi's Assistants enters the battlefield or you gain life, you may mill four cards. When you do, you may return a permanent card from your graveyard to your hand. This ability triggers no more than four times each turn.
cards.text: When Machi's Assistants enters the battlefield or you gain life, you may mill four cards. When you do, you may return a permanent card from your graveyard to your hand. This ability triggers no more than four times each turn.

cards.flavor: Matron of floods and rivers, her power grows with each step the Caica take.
cards.name: Mayu, the Endless Flow
cards.originalText:

cards.flavor: Cover the scar, embrace the pain. Win the war, so it won't be in vain.

cards.flavor: Aukan gave the heart of Amancay's killer to the condor, who flew away with it. Soon, the eruptions stopped.

cards.flavor:
“The Caica only seek to take away our freedom! With their own weapons of war, we will take them down!”
—Aukan, Swift Hawk

cards.flavor: Many souls that perished during the Great Flooding were turned into stones, with their inner rage turning them into powerful tools for revenge.

cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell from a graveyard or without paying its mana cost, Piriman Stones deals 5 damage to them.

cards.flavor: There is so much to be thankful for.

cards.flavor: “Any new road is a new home.”

cards.flavor: The Relonche spent little to no time deliberating their refusal to become a part of the Intisuyu, as well as the decision to start a war with the Caica...

cards.flavor: ...that time was saved to decide who should lead.

cards.flavor: As she fearfully opened her eyes within the Blind Eternities, Millaray saw Caru Mapu alive and well, and finally breathed a sigh of relief.

—Shining Capac Upanqui

—Millaray Antillanca

cards.flavor: The Intisiyu is long gone, ravaged by the Phyrexians and made impossible by The Mending. But the Caica live proudly in the plane of Pacha Marka.
cards.name: Twilight of the Intisuyu

cards.flavor: “Move it! You're part of the Intisuyu now, and only those who work hard can enjoy the benefits!”
cards.name: Unrelenting Noble

cards.flavor: The strongest link in the chain isn't the most powerful or most skillful messenger, but the one that has never failed to deliver.
cards.name: Unyielding Chasqui

cards.flavor: As Upanqui gazed at the Reloncaru Valley, he envisioned the plans for the greatest capital the Intisuyu had ever seen.
